list_definition.definition: a drink made by shaking up milk and a particular flavouring/flavoring

list_ex_of_english: In these locales, milkshake refers to a lighter drink, usually made of shaken or blended milk with flavoring of some sort.
It is intended for slush drinks and milkshakes.
Around 1885 the milkshake became a popular item at soda fountains.
These establishments often prominently displayed a shining chrome or stainless steel milkshake mixing machine.
It offers a simple menu with sandwiches and is best known for its desserts, most especially for its handmade malts or malted milkshakes.
This includes kosher beef patties, potatoes, lettuce, buns and milkshake mix.
It reminded me of the froth at the end of a strawberry milkshake—full of air, of little substance, rather sweet and sickly and unremittingly pink.
He had a frozen finger from a milkshake machine incident.
